description: In the two cell lines, high unique spectral counts corresponding to Cullin3 were identified in KLHL6(WT) immunoprecipitates as opposed to none in the KLHL6(L65P) purifications, indicating that Cullin3 is a novel KLHL6 binding partner and that a BTB-domain mutation (L65P) abolishes this interaction. Since KLHL6(L65P) is unable to promote ubiquitylation, we reasoned that it might trap (i.e.; interact with, but not ubiquitylate or degrade) natural KLHL6 substrates offering an opportunity to identify them. Thus, we ranked the identified proteins by the number of unique spectral counts associated to KLHL6(L65P) and compared them to KLHL6(WT). Roquin2 was enriched in the KLHL6(L65P) complex in both HEK293T cells and ARP-1 cells. Roquin2 is the first identified bona fide substrate of the CRL3KLHL6 E3 ubiquitin ligase complex.

terms.name: Dataset with no associated published manuscript

title: MudPIT analyses of the proteins associated with Kelch-like protein 6 (KLHL6) in a human multiple myeloma cell line, ARP-1, and in HEK293T cells
